questions.question: Which colour is the live wire in a three pin plug?

choices.answer: Green
Green and Yellow
Brown
Blue

questions.question: The wire with a green and yellow case is the...

choices.answer: Live wire
Earth wire
High wire
Neutral wire

questions.question: Which of these is true of direct current (D.C.)?

choices.answer: Electrons flow back and forwards in the circuit.
It is the type of current provided by the U.K. mains.
It is produced by a changing positive and negative voltage.
It is the type of current provided by a battery.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an electrical saftey feature?

choices.answer: Fuse
RCCB
Plastic casing
Standby mode

questions.question: When there is a surge of current, a fuse works by...

choices.answer: Sticking together the wires so that no current can flow
Melting at a specific current to break the circuit
Causing a fire inside the plug to burn out the electricity
Absorbing all of the extra electrons from the surge

questions.question: When there is a surge of current, a residual current circuit breaker works by...

choices.answer: Melting to break the circuit
Using residual current to set off an alarm
Breaking the circuit with an electromanget if current leaks
Breaking the circuit by dropping a large metal rod on it

questions.question: Which of the following is not an advantage of RCCBs when compared with fuses?

choices.answer: RCCBs can be reset using a switch
RCCBs break the circuit far faster than fuses
Circuit breakers are more sensitive than fuses
Circuit breakers are cheaper to instal than fuses
